isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 8500 DAY CAB and extended cab models

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 8500 DAY CAB and extended cab models

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 143 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 8500 day cab and extended cab models contains two air springs (bags) (Item 4), two shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 7). The air suspension assembly (Figure 143) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance

The following components - air lines (to air springs) (Item 13 and 15), tee fitting (Item 11), elbow fitting (Item 12), air springs (bags) (Item 4), height control valve (Item 7), shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) and lateral control rod (Item 3) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 7), air springs (bags) (Item 4) and shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 143) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 7, Figure 143) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 144 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Inspect height control valve (Item 3) to insure drive bearing notch (Item 14) on rear side of drive bearing (Item 13) is located on "SUPPLY" port side of valve. If not, loosen pan head bearing screw (Item 12), but not remove, and pull height control valve arm (Item 10) loose from drive bearing (Item 13). Rotate drive bearing until drive bearing notch is in correct position, then secure height control valve lever by tightening pan head bearing screw. Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-in (4.5 to 5.6 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 143 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 7) on mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).

Install two hex head bolts (Item 16) thru height control valve and mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex lock nuts (Item 17). Tighten hex head bolts and hex lock nuts to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (10.8 to 13.6 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 144 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Push air line (supply) (Item 2) into release collet (Item 1) of "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3) until it bottoms, push air line in again to make sure air line is inserted past collet and O-ring then pull on air line to check engagement of release collet.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 5) into compression nut (Item 4) of elbow fitting (Item 6) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.

Install height control valve linkage (Item 7) onto threaded ball pivot (Item 8) of height control valve arm (Item 10) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place, latch the linkage clip (Item 9).
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate of cab air suspension system (Figure 220) . Cab air suspension air spring (bag) design height is 4.76 inches (120.9 mm). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
Cab Air Suspension for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models
.

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 143 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install front shock absorber (Item 5) as follows.

step2.para: Position top of front shock absorber (Item 5) in place in shock mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install hex head bolt (Item 20) from passenger side and install hex lock nut (Item 21). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 20 and 21) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Position bottom of front shock absorber (Item 5) in place in shock mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Install hex head bolt (Item 20) from passenger side and install hex lock nut (Item 21). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 20 and 21) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

step1.para: Install rear shock absorber (Item 6) as follows.

step2.para: Position top of rear shock absorber (Item 6) in place in shock mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install hex head bolt (Item 20) from passenger side and install hex lock nut (Item 21). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 20 and 21) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Position bottom of rear shock absorber (Item 6) in place in shock mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Install hex head bolt (Item 20) from passenger side and install hex lock nut (Item 21). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 20 and 21) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 143 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4) into hole in cab mounting plate (Item 1) and over mounting hole in crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and secure as follows.

note.para: A new retaining ring (Item 24) is supplied with the new air spring (Bag).

step2.para: Install new retaining ring (Item 24) over stud top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4) and securely press on stud.
Install flat head cap screw (Item 23) thru crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) into bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4). Tighten to 2 to 4 Lbf-ft (3 to 5 N•m).
Apply pipe thread sealant to threads of elbow fitting (Item 12) and reinstall into top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4). Tighten hand tight plus 270 to 450 degrees.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 15) into compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 12) at top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.

step1.para: Position top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4) into hole in cab mounting plate (Item 1) and over mounting hole in crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and secure as follows.

note.para: A new retaining ring (Item 24) is supplied with the new air spring (Bag).

step2.para: Install new retaining ring (Item 24) over stud top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4) and securely press on stud.
Install flat head cap screw (Item 23) thru crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) into bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4). Tighten to 2 to 4 Lbf-ft (3 to 5 N•m).
Apply pipe thread sealant to threads of tee fitting (Item 11) and reinstall into top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4). Tighten hand tight plus 270 to 450 degrees.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 15) into compression nut of tee fitting (Item 11) at top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 13) into compression nut of tee fitting (Item 11) at top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

step1.para: Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate of cab air suspension system (Figure 220) . Cab air suspension air spring (bag) design height is 4.76 inches (120.9 mm). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
Cab Air Suspension for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 143 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod (Item 3) as follows.

step2.para: Position lateral control rod (Item 3) in mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and install hex head bolt (Item 22) from the rear thru mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 21). Tighten to 70 to 90 Lbf-ft (94.9 to 122 N•m).

Position lateral control rod (Item 3) in mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex head bolt (Item 22) from the rear thru mounting bracket of cab mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 21). Tighten to 70 to 90 Lbf-ft (94.9 to 122 N•m).

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab was raised and blocked about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate. Raise cab and remove block after serving is completed and before returning the vehicle to service.

svcsubproc.title: Install Jounce Bumper
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 143 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position jounce bumper (Item 10) underneath cab mounting plate (Item 1).

Install hex head bolt (Item 18) thru jounce bumper (Item 10) and cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex lock nut (Item 19) thru access hole in cab mounting plate . Tighten to 2 to 4 Lbf-ft (3 to 5 N•m).
